data.title: Great food + Great staff = WIN
data.text: I've eaten here several times in the past few years and I've never been let down. The breakfast croissants are huge and quite delicious when paired with bacon, egg and cheese. The burgers and Santa Fe chicken are great too, as are the fries and homemade chips. I've only tried a few of their items, but others I've dined with were always happy with their meals as well. And the staff is fantastic. I just wish they stayed open past 3pm.

data.title: Quaint Little Hidaway
data.text: I ordered the #33 Light and Healthy meal which was chicken salad, house salad and blueberry applesauce.  It was really good.  I didn't know I could a healthy meal there while my other friends gorge out on the burgers....which really look good.  My friends state the burgers are some of the best along with the homemade chips.  I cheated and ate and couple and they were great as well.  I recommend the deli.

data.title: Mediocre at best
data.text: I've been going to DT Deli since 2006 and I have to say that the past year or so, things have really slipped.  Used to be the best place for the typical deli fare - sandwiches, burgers, wraps, salads - but lately there always seems to be something wrong with the order.  Sandwich prepared wrong (they grilled a sandwich ordered ungrilled); wrong sides; ice tea comes out like tinted water.  My friend ordered a plain grilled chicken sandwich like she always used to, but now they serve it something like "Cajun" spiced which she was unable to eat, the staff explanation being they've switched vendors and you have to "ask" for a plain chicken breast, but no changes on their menu saying it's spiced already.  It has a pleasant sports bar ambience, is very conveniently located in downtown W-S, and the staff is friendly - which is why I give it 3-dots instead of 2.  But if you want to spend on average $8-10 for lunch, go spend that money elsewhere.

data.title: Best service, tasty sandwiches, but I miss the fried green beans
data.text:
This place consistently has the best service.  For a place where you stand in line to order your food, you wouldn't expect this, but ordering is the only work you do.  For the rest of your time there, drinks are refilled, napkins and utensils brought to your table, and most importantly, the food is brought your way.
The menu is pretty big, with a huge variety of sandwiches and burgers.  I've never been disappointed.  One of the highlights, though, is the fried green beans.  Unfortunately, they are currently missing from the menu.  I was told they would be back soon.  I'll be back either way.

data.title: Great burgers
data.text: They do great burgers at this place and they're actually kinda a unique burger.  They're not the fancy burgers that you get at a place where a waiter takes your order and they're not those thin fast-food-like burgers.  These are big fat burgers with shredded lettuce, mayo and cheese.  They're great.  I've eaten countless of them.  The facility is nice too and they always have the news or ESPN on the big-screens.  Make sure to order the Bull Burger if you want a little more meat.
